info.title: Avey Diagnostic API
info.description: Use our leading symptom checker AI to provide early patient care through differential diagnosis suggestions, self-management advice, specialist recommendation, and a triage assessment of how urgent the patient's presentation is

post.description:
Generates a clinical diagnosis and patient recommendations based on a patient's profile.
    Query parameters can be used to toggle:
        * Differential Diagnosis
        * Urgency (Triage)
        * Specialist Recommendation
        * Suggested Health Management Advice

parameters.name: differential

schema.description: If true, generates and returns a differential diagnosis list.

422.description: Validation Error: The request body is malformed.

post.description:
Starts a new interactive diagnostic session. Provide the patient's initial information
    (age, sex, and chief complaints) to create a session and receive the first question.
    A unique `session_id` is returned, which you must use for all subsequent calls.

200.description: Session successfully created and first question returned.

422.description: Validation Error, e.g., could not extract any symptoms from input text.

post.description:
Submits an answer to the previous question and retrieves the next one.
    When the model has enough information, or if the question limit set for the session is reached, the `question` field in the response will be `null`.

CodingType.title: CodingType
CodingType.description: Specifies the medical coding system used for providing chief concpet identifiers in the beginning of a session. Avey Unified Terminology (aut) is our internally developed naming system designed to be simple for developers to work with while remaining medically expressive. It uses unique strings for each name, making it convenient to use the name as the term's identifier.

id.title: Id
id.description: The unique identifier of the concept in its coding system.

term.title: Term
term.description: The human-readable name of the concept.

Concept.title: Concept
Concept.description: Represents a general medical concept, like a symptom or condition.

DiagnoseRequest.title: DiagnoseRequest
DiagnoseRequest.description: Request the Clinical Diagnosis of a Patient Profile.

differential_diagnosis.title: Differential Diagnosis
differential_diagnosis.description: A ranked list of possible conditions matching the patient's profile.

examples.description: Commonly known as the common cold, this is a viral infection of your nose and throat.
examples.note: Often resolves on its own within 7-10 days.
examples.treatment: Rest, fluids, and over-the-counter medications can help relieve symptoms.

examples.description: Commonly known as the flu, this is a contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses.
examples.note: Symptoms are typically more severe than a cold and can include fever, body aches, and fatigue.
examples.treatment: Antiviral drugs may be prescribed. Rest and fluid intake are crucial for recovery.

self_management.title: Self Management
self_management.description: Advice for managing symptoms at home.
examples: Stay hydrated and get plenty of rest. Over-the-counter pain relievers can help with aches.

urgency.title: Urgency
urgency.description: A high-level indicator of the situation's urgency
examples: Non-Urgent, but schedule a visit with your physician
Urgent, seek medical care and watch your symptoms closely

specialist.title: Specialist

description.title: Description
description.description: A clinical description of the disease.

Disease.title: Disease
Disease.description: Detailed information about a potential disease or condition in a differential diagnosis.

id.title: Id
id.description: The unique identifier of the concept in its coding system.

term.title: Term
term.description: The human-readable name of the concept.

status.description: The lowercased status of the finding as reported by the patient.

Finding.title: Finding
Finding.description: A medical concept with a reported status from the patient.

id.title: Id
id.description: The concept ID of the finding being answered.

FindingAnswer.title: FindingAnswer
FindingAnswer.description: An answer to a text-based question.

FindingStatus.title: FindingStatus
FindingStatus.description: The patient's reported status for a given finding or symptom.

coding_type.description: The desired coding system for all concepts in the session.

max_questions.title: Max Questions
max_questions.description: The maximum number of questions the model should ask during the session. By default, the model takes on average around 10-20 questions before it converges to an accurate medical diagnosis.

input_text.title: Input Text
input_text.description: Free-text input describing the patient's symptoms. Either this or a list of chief symptom codes must be provided.
examples: My tummy hurts, and i feel like i don't want to eat anything

Question.title: Question
Question.description: A container for a question, using a discriminated union for the content.

text.title: Text
text.description: The question to be displayed to the user.

target_concept.description: The medical concept this question is about.

TextQuestion.title: TextQuestion
TextQuestion.description: A standard text-based question targeting a specific medical concept.

question_id.title: Question Id
question_id.description: The ID of the question being answered.

answers.title: Answers
answers.description: A list of answers for text-based questions. Either this object or input_text must be provided

input_text.title: Input Text
input_text.description: Free-text input from the user. Either this or an answers object must be provided
examples: No, but i find it difficult to sleep at night

UpdateSessionRequest.title: UpdateSessionRequest
UpdateSessionRequest.description: Payload to submit answers and get the next question.

question.description: The next question to ask. If null, the interview phase is complete.

patient_info.description: An updated snapshot of the patient's information after the model process new findings. The model may add new concepts by medically supported inductive reasoning. For example, if menstruation is found to be present. The model may add pregnancy to be absent depending on the patient case.

UpdateSessionResponse.title: UpdateSessionResponse
UpdateSessionResponse.description:
Response to an answer submission. Contains either the next question or null.
When 'question' is null, the session is over. The client should then copy the returned
'patient_info' and use it to make a final call to the defined diagnosis endpoint.
